messages: b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:36): AryehGregor: Yes, better stringification seems like a good idea.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:37): Also, there is no need to make Opera fail all your tests just because :)

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:38): Well specifically it's not clear that setting things up so that one bug causes everything to fail is that useful, since it will have the effect of hiding more significant bugs
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:38): Although I do of course agree that we should fix the null-handling issues

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:48): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, regarding the stability of DOM Core; I would say it is pretty stable but we are planning a number of experiments that make a few specific parts "less stable"
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:48): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, i.e. killing the concept of Attr being a node
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:48): it's not really stableness i'm worried about so much as completeness
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:49): last i saw it, it was extremely incomplete
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:49): really?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:49): well last i saw it was months ago :-)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:49): the Nodes part has not changed much since publication
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:49): what's the url these days?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:50): http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/domcore/raw-file/tip/Overview.html
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:51): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I am like 90% sure that Closure relies on the nodeness of Attr
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:51): If it doesn't, it does a very good job of faking it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:51): ok well step one will have to be me going very carefully through the definitions to make sure i didn't change any since the text was copied
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:51): So I think we already lost there
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:52): would be happy to be proven wrong
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (09:52): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea, I'm sure some stuff will break, we'll have to figure out how much we can battle it with alpha builds
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:52): If some stuff === most Google properties, we have a problem
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:52): oh wow, this definition of Event is so much better than I'm used to.
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (09:54): http://www.google.com/codesearch?q=getAttributeNode+package%3Ahttp%3A%2F%2Fclosure-library\.googlecode\.com&origq=getAttributeNode&btnG=Search+Trunk
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:54): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: yeah, wow, this is way more complete than the last time i saw it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:54): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: this is awesometastic
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:55): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e++ Ms2ger++
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:55): k well i guess it's time to start moving to that draft
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:56): this is so much more readable than dom3 core
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:02): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: filed bug 12094 on switching to web dom core

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:03): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: when i do it i'll go through the definitions carefully and any that are identical and make more sense in dom core i'll just reference dom core -- please let me know if you ever change those definitions since they can have really drastic ramifications
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:04): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, yeah, pretty sure Ms2ger and I can keep on top of that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:04): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, we have for exceptions at least :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:04): cool :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:05): seeing how web dome core has matured really made my day :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:05): web dom core, even
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (10:07): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: time for a publication heartbeat for web dom core?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:09): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, that is the plan yes, before I leave :)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:10): I want to fix the issues with events smaug pointed out I think
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:11): http://irinawerning.com/back-to-the-fut/back-to-the-future/ is pretty amazing
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:23): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, I thought readonly meant something like is disabled but is submitted
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:23): readonly means "interactive but not mutable"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:23): it also as a side-effect is submitted when disabled is not
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:23): but that's more of a historical artefact
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:24): readonly just comes from the fact that UI toolkits for text fields have this "readonly" state separate from the disabled state
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:24): mkay
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:24): so when browsers first did this, it made sense to add readonly for text fields
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:26): http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=11483#c1 <-- damnit. :-P

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: re http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=11452, it would be helpful if you could make a list of all the ways that rfc2388 is problematic -- that would give me cover to just go and respec it from scratch

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: if i just do it people will go ballistic as usual about how we're ignoring standards, and it would be good to have an explanation of the problems
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: (it would also allow me to approach larry and ask him if he's willing to fix the spec first)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (10:39): be great if he could do that; I'll give it a shot
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:43): do websockets keep track of message ids themselves?
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:43): i got some sync problems

2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:49): well, i got two messages firing now at the moment: one to get online users, and one to sync a canvas painting app. Both arrive in this jquery websocket router: http://paste.pocoo.org/show/339478/
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:50): the callback is fired twice somehow, so i thought i maybe have to queue the messages and match them on origin
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:50): if a message comes in, i would like to be able which event fired it
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:51): i started with jsonrpc which had a message id in it, but removed that(it had a function i guess :) )
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (10:51): someone should make "Wikipedia > IANA" t-shirts
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:52): so, i was wondering if the websocket api has a way to find out which message belongs to which call
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:52): or do i have to add the message id manually again
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:52): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: and you say _I'm_ unnecessarily antagonistic. :-P
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (10:53): having a 36 char uuid in there seems not to be good for small message parsing
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (10:55): what happened to https://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/web-dom-core/ ?

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:01): 2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c: I'm not quite sure I follow. In general if you have a DOM event you can work out what type of event it is. But if you have two message events, the API doesn't provide any unique identifier for each; you hvae to do that at the application ("subprotocol") level
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:01): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, bitbucket does not redirect :/ https://bitbucket.org/ms2ger/dom-core/
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:01): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: i was already affraid for that :)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:02): 2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c: Well it's not clear to me what it would provide
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:03): hm, i hoped for some id in the send message thats linked to the message event
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:03): but it can be done in the application indeed
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:04): What do you mean "linked to the message event"?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:04): You mean the DOM event object?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:04): or something different?
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:04): yea, i dont know if thats even possible but
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:05): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, also it did not advertise that changing the name changes the URL
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:05): should I change it back?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:06): 2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c: Well as long as you are entirely on the client, the message is already bound to the event object
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:06): Since it is e.data that contains the message
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (11:06): But I guess you don't mean that
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:07): yea, thats what i meant
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:07): i think i got it. in the message object, i can see the original calling function in .target.origin
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:08): or not...hm, ill see if i can fix it like this first
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:16): hm, any idea why origin sometimes is overwritten with two subsequent ws messages? http://paste.pocoo.org/show/339489/
2c801963ac4e96f503bacd185b18a79c (11:16): two origins should be different, but most of the times they are the same
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:19): whoa
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (11:19): constructive feedback from Jukka Korpela on the WHATWG list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (11:21): ok bed time
